intro: Krigia dichotoma, commonly known as the common krigia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, lobed leaves and produces clusters of yellow flowers with five petals. It thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Krigia dichotoma is an annual plant that blooms from spring to early summer.
